CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 21, 1952, pg. 4, reads: "Special Committee on Adoptions - A group of laymen have recently joined with the staff of Family and Children's Service, a Red Feather agency, to help solve the problem of too few homes for Negro youngsters now waiting in vain in foster homes and institutions for someone to adopt them. Seated left to right: Mrs. Bessie King and Miss Serema Niles staff workers; Mrs. Geroge Little, Homestead; Mrs. Nathaniel Dandridge, chairman on the committee; Mrs. Marion Jordon NAACP, and Mrs. James Burgett. Standing: Mrs. Eugene Roberts, Penn Township; Mrs. Lucille Sparks, of the staff; Perry B. Hall, director of Family and Children's Service; Mrs. Belle Glosser, of the staff; Mrs. Janie Garland, McKeesport; Mrs. Alice Brad, Homewood; Miss Clair Fagrie, of the staff; the Rev. John F. Little, pastor of Calvary Methodist Church in Braddock; Miss Elizabeth Learn of the staff; Mrs. Eila Jackson, Urban League; The Rev. Harold Hays, pastor of Bethlehem Baptist Church, McKeesport; Mrs. John P. Bankston. chairman of the Family and Children's Welfare Division of the Health and Welfare Federation; Mrs. Leroy A. Patrick and Miss Thelma Flowers of the staff. - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of committee on adoptions, seated from left: Bessie King, Serema Niles, Mrs. George Little, Helen Dandridge, Marion Bond Jordon, and Mrs. James Burgett, standing: Mrs. Eugene Roberts, Lucille Sparks, Perry B. Hall, Belle Glosser, Janie Garland, Alice Brad, Clair Fagrie, Rev. John F. Little, Elizabeth Learn, Eila Jackson, Rev. Harold Hays, Mrs. John P. Bankston, Mrs. Leroy A. Patrick, and Thelma Flowers
